sentences.english: Once upon a barren moor there dwelt a bear, also a boar.
sentences.chinese: 從前，在一個貧瘠的荒野裏住了一隻熊和一隻公野豬。

sentences.english: And the fourth one is currently called Into the Wild Green Yonder.
sentences.chinese: 第四部電影的名字暫定爲《荒野綠林的彼端》。

sentences.english: Hence, future generations may have a stronger demand for wilderness areas than current generations .
sentences.chinese: 現在和未來的幾代人對荒野面積的需求會更強烈。

sentences.english: Sound background have 5 reiterative wilds sounds.
sentences.chinese: 健全的背景有5反覆荒野的聲音。

sentences.english: They're shooting grouse up on the moors.
It is nto the same thing to have a bare field in January and in Juluy.
sentences.chinese: 一月和七月的荒野是截然不同的。

sentences.english: Whenever the grass was dry the children would cut across me fields instead of keeping to the road.
sentences.chinese: 每當草木枯乾時，孩子們寧走荒野也不去走大路。

sentences.english: I am the gentle showers of rain, on Westfall's fields of golden grain.
sentences.chinese: 我是柔和細膩的雨，灑過西部荒野金色的田野。

sentences.english: A wilderness, remote non-life, in the eyes of photographers is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 一片荒野，渺無生機，在攝影家的眼裏是美的。

sentences.english: Bonny bird; wheeling over our heads in the middle of the moor.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的鳥兒，在荒野地裏，在我們頭頂上回翔。

sentences.english: Like heath that, in the wilderness, The wild wind whirls away.
sentences.chinese: 像荒野中的石楠被一陣狂風捲走。

sentences.english: Macbeth receives a prophecy on the heath.
sentences.chinese: 麥克白在荒野中得到一個預言。

sentences.english: That it should rain on the earth without man in the wilderness, where no mortal dwelleth.
sentences.chinese: 好使雨落在無人之境，降在無人的荒野。

sentences.english: This was once India's great wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 這裏曾是印度的大荒野。

definition: left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
